dataset.title: Saddle (3525 m) climate station: Precipitation data.

address.deliveryPoint: Institute of Arctic and Alpine Research

abstract.para: Precipitation data were collected from a ridgetop Niwot Ridge climate station (Saddle @ 3525 m) throughout the year using a chart recorder. Instrumentation consisted of a Fergusson-type weighing rain gauge. Precipitation was caught in a bucket containing ethylene glycol (to melt snow) and light oil (to prevent evaporation). As the weight of the bucket increased, the pen moved up via a spring mechanism and recorded on a rotating chart. A snow fence was placed around the gauge to give more accurate precipitation measurements during windy conditions.

description.para: The documentation section of this file was developed from the NWT LTER Data Directory (Symphony files DDABSTRA.WR1, DDDOCUME.WR1, DDMASTER.WR1, DDVARIAB.WR1; last updated 16 December 1991) by Mike Sannes and Rick Ingersoll during the summer of 1993. Data for the periods from 5 January 1988 to 19 July 1993 were appended to the data section on 27 August 1993 and the file was put under sccs control at that time as well. [RCI 27 August 1993] Data for 1 to 8 January 1991 were inserted in, and data for the period 20 July to 23 August 1993 were appended to, the data section on 2 September 1993.[RCI 2 September 1993] Comments provided by Mark Losleben on 15 September 1993 were incorporated into the documentation section on 1 October 1993.[RCI 1 October 1993] Corrections were made to precipitation and number of qualifying days for the 8 to 9 February and 18 to 19 March 1993 records on 14 October 1993. Data for 24 August through 4 October 1993 were appended to the data section on 14 October 1993. Comments regarding 7 to 16 September 1993 precipitation were added to the documentation section on 14 October 1993.[RCI 14 October 1993] Data for 5 October to 8 November 1993 were appended to the data section on 22 November 1993.[RCI 22 November 1993] Data for 9 November 1993 to 3 January 1994 were appended to the data section on 11 January 1994.[RCI 11 January 1994] Data for 4 to 31 January 1994 were appended to the data section on 9 February 1994.[RCI 9 February 1994] Missing value indicators were changed from * to absence of value to conserve space and to be more consistent with other climate data files. [RCI 21 February 1994] Data for the period 1 February to 16 March 1994 were appended to the data section on 5 April 1994.[RCI 5 April 1994] Data for the period 17 March to 16 May were appended to the
